episodes.title: Journey into the World of Transcendental Meditation - David Wants To Fly (Documentary, 2010)
episodes.description:
David Sieveking follows the path of his idol, David Lynch, into the world of transcendental meditation (TM). That leads him to the movement’s founder, Maharishi, the one-time guru of the Beatles. Today, TM is a global conglomerate, promising world peace and yogic flying. How does this chime with the dark films of David Lynch? Inspired by his idol, the young director starts to meditate, too, submerging himself ever deeper in the strange world of TM.

-------

The unprecedented success story of Maharishi Mahesh Yogi began in the Himalayas. In order to spread his meditation teachings and achieve world peace, the Indian guru came to Hollywood at the end of the 1950s and gained numerous celebrity followers, such as the Beatles, Mia Farrow and Clint Eastwood. Today, almost six million people worldwide practise Transcendental Meditation (TM). David, a young filmmaker in search of inspiration, also wants to try meditation. His idol, the legendary director David Lynch, personally assures him that TM is a source of creativity and the key to success.

David decides to take his idol at his word: He undergoes the expensive meditation training, receives his personal mantra and tries his hand at yogic flying. But the inconsistencies soon mount up. The Indian guru's organization has become an industry worth billions. When Maharishi suddenly dies, there is a dispute over the successor. David Lynch becomes the organization's most important international ambassador.

Despite all his doubts and the break-up with his girlfriend, David continues to hope for enlightenment. The filmmaker becomes a pilgrim on the trail of the TM movement. His steps are now closely followed by the organization - as he gets too close to some well-kept secrets. When David Lynch finally acknowledges the film team's research with a threat of legal action, the inner peace is gone. David travels to the USA and India: instead of the “heaven on earth” prophesied by Maharishi, he encounters abysses. Finally, in the heights of the Himalayas, at the icy source of the Ganges, David finds his own truth.

David Sieveking manages the feat of telling his detective-like search for meaning as a light-footed journey into the cinematic self. On his adventurous odyssey from Berlin's Teufelsberg via Hollywood to the Himalayas, he combines spiritual experiences and bizarre observations with exciting documentary investigation.

#documentary #fulldocumentary #transcendentalmeditation #davidlynch #maharishi

episodes.title: Inside Osho's controversial cult - The dark side of the Rajneesh movement (Full Documentary, 2013)
episodes.description:
The wild 1970s. A quest for higher consciousness, spirituality and sexual freedom. In
his Ashram in Poona, Bhagwan urges his disciples to meditate and practise tantric sex in order
to reach a higher level of consciousness. Hugh, the guru’s bodyguard, watches his ascent on
people. Sheela becomes his secretary and the powerful boss of Bhagwan’s community in the
mountains of Oregon. The guru, decried as ”sex-guru” by the Western media in the 1970s, is
now making headlines with his Rolls-Royces. The dream turns into a nightmare, for Hugh into a
mental breakdown, for Sheela into a prison sentence. Where did it all begin to go wrong?

-------
Chapters
▷ 0:00:00 - Intro
▷ 0:03:58 - Rajneesh as a religious movement
▷ 0:06:50 - Osho's family background
▷ 0:13:09 - Bhagwan Rajneesh
▷ 0:14:53 - Feelings
▷ 0:17:16 - The pressure on Rajneesh
▷ 0:03:58 - Rajneesh as a religious movement
▷ 0:23:07 - Love for life
▷ 0:26:30 - Paradise
▷ 0:31:31 - Therapy
▷ 0:47:58 - The beginning
▷ 0:49:22 - Working Vision
▷ 0:51:45 - Big Muddy Ranch
▷ 1:33:13 - Credits
